# google\_redis\_instance

Get info about a Google Cloud Redis instance.

## Example Usage

```python
import constructs as constructs
import cdktf as cdktf
# Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
# See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.
import ...gen.providers.google as google
class MyConvertedCode(cdktf.TerraformStack):
    def __init__(self, scope, name):
        super().__init__(scope, name)
        data_google_redis_instance_my_instance =
        google.data_google_redis_instance.DataGoogleRedisInstance(self, "my_instance",
            name="my-redis-instance"
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "instance_authorized_network",
            value=data_google_redis_instance_my_instance.authorized_network
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "instance_connect_mode",
            value=data_google_redis_instance_my_instance.connect_mode
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "instance_memory_size_gb",
            value=data_google_redis_instance_my_instance.memory_size_gb
        )
```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `name` - (Required) The name of a Redis instance.

- - -

* `project` - (Optional) The project in which the resource belongs. If it
    is not provided, the provider project is used.

* `region` - (Optional) The region in which the resource belongs. If it
    is not provided, the provider region is used.

## Attributes Reference

See [google_redis_instance](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs/resources/redis_instance) resource for details of the available attributes.
